017package org.apache.commons.text.similarity;
018
019/**
020 * An edit distance algorithm based on the length of the longest common subsequence between two strings.
021 *
022 * <p>
023 * This code is directly based upon the implementation in {@link LongestCommonSubsequence}.
024 * </p>
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * For reference see: <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longest_common_subsequence_problem">
028 * https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longest_common_subsequence_problem</a>.
029 * </p>
030 *
031 * <p>For further reading see:</p>
032 *
033 * <p>Lothaire, M. <em>Applied combinatorics on words</em>. New York: Cambridge U Press, 2005. <strong>12-13</strong></p>
034 *
035 * @since 1.0
036 */
037public class LongestCommonSubsequenceDistance implements EditDistance<Integer> {
038
039    /**
040     * Creates a new instance.
041     */
042    public LongestCommonSubsequenceDistance() {
043        // empty
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * Calculates an edit distance between two {@code CharSequence}'s {@code left} and {@code right} as:
048     * {@code left.length() + right.length() - 2 * LCS(left, right)}, where {@code LCS} is given in
049     * {@link LongestCommonSubsequence#apply(CharSequence, CharSequence)}.
050     *
051     * @param left  first character sequence.
052     * @param right second character sequence.
053     * @return distance.
054     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if either String input {@code null}.
055     */
056    @Override
057    public Integer apply(final CharSequence left, final CharSequence right) {
058        // Quick return for invalid inputs
059        if (left == null || right == null) {
060            throw new IllegalArgumentException("Inputs must not be null");
061        }
062        return left.length() + right.length() - 2 * LongestCommonSubsequence.INSTANCE.apply(left, right);
063    }
064
065}
